name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: It was only 120 days ago we were still reeling from the COVID-19 winter surge and navigating our path forward out of this crisis. What began in uncertain times will conclude with a feeling of hope and confidence in our comeback.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I am proud to announce that as of yesterday, 13,813 COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered to Nevadans 12-15 years of age – This is just two weeks after the vaccine became available to this age group. Every shot gets us one step closer to a full recovery!  https://t.co/Ud9ZC2f2Nh

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Thank you to our talented student athletes & coaches, who bring passion & dedication to their sports — and make up so many of Nevada's #3MillionReasons! Watch as they encourage you to get COVID-19 vaccines so we can all safely gather & cheer again  https://t.co/GhjHfzIGve

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: We’re working hard every day to meet Nevadans where they are, making COVID-19 vaccines accessible to as many people as possible. Great to see creative efforts like those of @JustinJonesNV, @NevadaHANDLV, and @TouroNevada.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Since the start of their largest & lengthiest activation in the history of NV, the National Guard have been essential in supporting COVID-19-related missions. I proposed this sales tax holiday as one way we can show our appreciation for all they have done & continue to do for NV.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The holiday would affect about 4,400 active members of the @NVNationalGuard & members of their household.   This piece of legislation is aimed at supporting the brave men & women who have continued to step up as the heroes our State needed during this COVID-19 crisis.  https://t.co/l6osIbTBxg

tweet: Seeing our loved ones safe and protected against COVID-19 is indeed one of the best reasons to support lifesaving #COVID19vaccines, @_raquelcruzj! Thank you for sharing and for also being one of Nevada’s #3MillionReasons.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: State agencies like @Nevada_ONA are working around the clock to help bridge that gap by providing translated material for those that may need it and helping bring the COVID-19 testing clinics and vaccination centers to them.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The COVID-19 pandemic is the largest and lengthiest state activation in the Nevada National Guard’s 160-year history This sales tax holiday is one way we can show our deep gratitude and appreciation for all the Nevada Guard does for the Silver State, home and abroad.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Today, my proposal to create a sales tax holiday for members of the @NVNationalGuard & their families was introduced in the Nevada State Senate. name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Nevada was the hardest hit state in the country from the economic impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. We look forward to working with #NVLEG on this bold infrastructure proposal that will improve the quality of life for thousands of Nevada families.    It’s time to get to work.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Increasing the number of Nevadans who are vaccinated against COVID-19 will help reduce the potential for more Nevadans to get sick and die.  Every shot in an arm puts us one step closer on our path to full recovery.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Vaccination doesn't just protect you from COVID-19 as an individual. It also protects the people around you. When you're fully vaccinated, you're much less likely to get infected and much less likely to spread the virus.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I want to encourage all Nevadans who may not have yet chosen to get their COVID-19 vaccine to consider speaking to their pharmacist or physician if you still have questions. You can visit NV COVID FIGHTER DOT ORG to learn more about the COVID-19 vaccine.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Before I close this address, I want to take a moment to talk to about our COVID-19 vaccine rollout. As I’ve mentioned, the speed and efficiency of the vaccine rollout was a key factor in the positive economic forecast announced yesterday.

tweet: The availability of COVID-19 vaccine is crucial as we continue our efforts to protect our communities. I am proud of the work being done at sites statewide – more than 690,000 doses administered – & I offer my thanks to all of those working for their fellow Nevadans.

tweet: With the review of the Janssen COVID-19 vaccine, the  Workgroup has again come together to ensure we have a safe, effective vaccine available to residents. Their review of this vaccine should give Nevadans added confidence to say ‘yes’ to any of the 3 vaccines offered.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Washington, Oregon & Nevada joined California’s COVID-19 Scientific Safety Review Workgroup in October. The workgroup has concurrently & independently reviewed FDA actions related to COVID-19 vaccines. It will continue to evaluate vaccines as they go through the process.

tweet: The Western States Scientific Safety Review Workgroup last night completed its review of the federal process & has concluded the Janssen (Johnson & Johnson) COVID-19 vaccine is safe and efficacious for use in the Western States.

name: Governor Sisolak

tweet: This is a stark difference from the spring when the additional assistance from the federal government helped many of Nevada’s most vulnerable workers displaced by COVID receive unemployment benefits that replaced roughly 100% of their lost income. That reality no longer exists.

tweet: Of all NV COVID cases: 10% occurred in the last 7 days 25% occurred in November alone 48% occurred since September  Approximately every 8 seconds a Nevadan is tested for COVID, every minute a Nevadan is diagnosed with COVID & every two hours, a Nevadan loses their life to COVID.  https://t.co/i57MGCn4e9

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I said from the start of this pandemic, I'd always be honest with Nevadans about the reality of our COVID situation, and right now our situation is dangerous.  It requires us to act with vigilance immediately to protect our State. Here's a look at our currently reality:

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I am glad to see so many Nevadans have already downloaded the COVID Trace app. This innovative tool was created with your privacy in mind and a key tool in our contact tracing efforts in the State.   Learn more below and download the app today:

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: New (not so great) COVID fact: Since the start of the pandemic, a quarter (24%) of ALL #COVID19 cases in Nevada were identified in the month of November.   We must take this seriously and act now.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Throughout this crisis, we have been talking about protecting our vulnerable populations. While children are not as physically vulnerable to COVID as the elderly or medically at-risk, that certainly doesn’t mean that they are immune to its effects.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: As a reminder, every business, venue & gathering space is required to post capacity limits under COVID-19 directives at all public entrances. You can find downloadable capacity signs on the NV Health Response website.   https://t.co/McGoGqo5mM

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Going forward, we will reduce capacity in certain high-risk areas that have been shown nationally and in Nevada to contribute to the spread of COVID-19.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: It’s not just for COVID –if you get in a car accident, or have a heart attack, or break a wrist...you won’t be able to access care if our hospitals are full and there isn’t enough staff.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Let me explain this quickly: whether you believe in the science of COVID or not, the reality is this – COVID is filling up our hospital beds and that threatens all Nevadans.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Some of our hospitals are experiencing staffing shortages because they have become infected or their family members have been diagnosed with COVID and workers are in quarantine.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: In fact, 10% of all COVID cases recorded in Nevada since the beginning of the pandemic were reported in the last seven days.  Every minute, a Nevadan is diagnosed with COVID-19.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: All of you are aware of the escalating COVID-19 cases in our nation and in our state. Almost two weeks ago, I asked that we step up our efforts to mitigate the spread of this dangerous and highly contagious virus.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Although I’m not experiencing symptoms, many Nevadans whodo. My heart goes out to all t hose who are sick with this virus , and to the families of the more than 2,000 Nevadans who died from COVID-19. Not a day goes by where I don’t think about these families and their grief.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Thank you all for joining me in this virtual format today for this press conference. As many of you know, I tested positive for COVID. I’m feeling good and am not experiencing any symptoms.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I am incredibly concerned about the severity of COVID-19 in our State, as demonstrated in the increase in numbers. My administration is exploring all mitigation options available to get this under control, while walking a tightrope to balance public health & economic impacts.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: First, I want to thank all the Nevadans who have reached out and taken the time to check in on me since my COVID-19 diagnosis. I am doing well, with only mild head congestion earlier this week.

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Though we could not have anticipated the COVID-19 pandemic when I appointed her in April 2019, we are especially fortunate to have a national leader in educational technology spearheading the Nevada Department of Education’s response during this challenging time.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Caleb will continue his work as the State’s COVID-19 Response Director, where he has been a steadfast leader bringing together stakeholders and resources across Nevada. I’m proud he will continue to represent our State through this fellowship.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Prior to today’s test, I received negative results on all previous tests – including my last two regular COVID tests conducted on Monday, Nov. 2 and Friday, Nov. 6. Consistent with guidelines from the CDC and the DHHS, I am isolating and continuing to monitor my symptoms.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: At this time, I am not experiencing any COVID-19 symptoms. Earlier this week, I felt a little fatigue, which I attributed to my demanding schedule. No other symptoms were experienced.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: As part of a regular testing protocol, I underwent routine COVID-19 testing on Friday, November 13 in Carson City. A rapid test provided a positive result. I also received a diagnostic PCR test and those results are pending at this time.  https://t.co/bfI16HlTpk

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: STAY HOME if you have any flu-like symptoms. Promptly get tested, isolate until you get the results. Activate the COVID Trace App.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: If we can take action now, we can keep our businesses open, reduce the spread of COVID, save lives and keep our healthcare system from being overwhelmed.  As government officials, we can only adopt and enforce restrictions in businesses and public spaces.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: We know more now. We believe that we can safely reduce the spread of COVID in our communities without requiring closing of sectors of our economy. To do this, we are asking each Nevadan to do your part in slowing the spread of COVID and protecting our most vulnerable.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: When we first implemented stay-at-home orders, much of Nevada was closed, including many of our key industries. This action was taken to avoid overwhelming our healthcare facilities and to reduce COVID-related fatalities.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: We know from experience that temporarily decreasing our activity in the community can significantly reduce the spread of COVID-19 and reduce the burden on our healthcare system.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The only proven way to control the current widespread transmission of COVID is to decrease mobility - that means staying home as much as we possibly can.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: To preserve our economy, we MUST refocus on preventing the spread of COVID-19. We have to go back to the basics, which by now are common knowledge. Wearing masks, maintaining social distance of at least 6 feet & limiting the risk of exposure are the ONLY ways we can keep going.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The Nevada Hospital Association reports a continued upward trajectory of COVID-19 cases. Monday marked the highest recorded number of hospitalizations since mid-August, effectively erasing the progress made over the past 3 months.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: I am encouraged by this week’s news about a potential COVID vaccine. It gives me hope and should give you hope. Our Nevada team is closely monitoring these updates and adjusting our vaccine distribution framework so we are ready when the time comes.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Good evening, thank you for being here tonight for this important COVID-19 update.  Tonight, I am grateful that @RenownCEOTonyMD, the president & chief executive officer at Renown Health is here with me to share the burden COVID is having on our communities.

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Now is not the time to get complacent or to give into COVID fatigue. Especially on Nevada Day, I implore all residents to tap into their Battle Born spirit and work together to follow the public health measures.

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Avoid large crowds – make sure you’re social distancing especially if you are indoors.     Be mindful of your interactions with others.   Get a test if you have been exposed to someone who may have COVID-19.    Get a flu shot.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: So here it is Nevadans. Here is my call to action to each & every one of you.     We must remain vigilant against COVID.     Wear your mask properly – that means completely over your nose and your mouth.     Practice social distancing.     Wash your hands.  https://t.co/Qs5CwIRm9s

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: That’s part of the reason why we implemented and have been encouraging Nevadans to download and use the COVID Trace App. It helps supplement our traditional disease investigation . You can learn more about the app here:    https://t.co/AsubPEy5MR

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Hospitals have learned a lot in the last 8 months about caring and treating for COVID. But that’s not through luck. That’s through the hard work of our medical professionals each and every day to provide the highest levels of care.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The number of new cases of COVID-19 began to increase at the end of September. We are seeing an infection rate above 1, which means it will continue to spread unless there are changes in our behavior. The 14-day test positivity rate has climbed to 10 percent.  https://t.co/jCporSPT6x

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Nationwide, trends are indicating that new cases are being driven by relatively small gatherings of families and friends where folks are more likely to let their guards down. That’s the COVID fatigue setting in. We must overcome it.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Especially in flu season, getting a flu shot is more important than ever. Combo of flu and COVID could place an additional burden on our hospitals. Do your part. @ImmunizeNV has locations and more information on flu shots.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: And while our healthcare infrastructure continues to be moderately impacted by COVID-19 hospitalizations at this time, we know from experience that an increase in cases ultimately leads to an increase in hospitalizations.

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Again, we want to stress that initial supplies of vaccine are expected to be limited and therefore will be prioritized for populations most at risk for exposure to COVID-19.  We are committed to an equitable distribution of a safe vaccine.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: To develop NV's COVID-19 vaccine plan we had to consider a variety of factors to be prepared for different vaccines when they becomes available  Some criteria may change, but, from what we know, there will be challenges related to storing, handling & distributing this vaccine.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: To meet the aggressive timeline of the fed govt's Operation Warp Speed, the COVID-19 vaccine is being manufactured while in the clinical trial phase.  That's why a vaccine will be available as soon as the manufacturer can present a strong case to the FDA for emergency use.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The NV Web IZ system has been in existence for years & is widely used by Nevada’s immunizing providers & NV state law requires all vaccines must be entered in the system. It will be used to manage and distribute COVID-19 vaccine in the same way.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: We anticipate receiving a small # of doses to begin & we've developed priority populations based on level of exposure. Our prioritization focuses on our front-line medical professionals 1st, especially for those who are in close & sustained contact with individuals who have COVID

name: Governor Sisolak

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: If we allow the fatigue to take over, the virus will spread.   Wear a face covering.  Practice social distancing.  Wash your hands.  Get a flu shot.  Get a COVID test.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Next, I want to talk about a term that’s been gaining a lot of recognition lately and that’s “COVID fatigue.” Back in the spring the message was “15 days to flatten the curve.” COVID wasn’t supposed to last this long.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: But hospitalizations are steadily increasing in Nevada. Things can change over a matter of days – especially in flu season. Flu shot is more important than ever. Combo of flu and COVID could place burden on hospitals. Do your part: visit @ImmunizeNV for more info.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Nevada is not currently experiencing concerns related to hospital saturation or critical infrastructure overload based on COVID patients, with relative demand placed on hospitals by COVID at approximately 10%.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Thanks for joining me today, Nevada. I wanted to provide an update on our current COVID-19 situation and how what we do as Nevadans in the coming days and weeks can make the difference as the country faces a fall surge. Follow along⬇️

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Because unlike the President, not every Nevadan and American who is infected with COVID-19 has access to Walter Reed medical center, countless doctors & treatments.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: COVID-19 isn’t political. It doesn’t know there’s an upcoming election.  On the other hand, the virus is highly infectious. According to the CDC, about 2/3 of COVID infections come from people who show no symptoms. That's why health officials recommend avoiding large gatherings.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: The last 7 months have been hard. The sacrifices made by Nevadans have led to exhaustion & frustration. “COVID fatigue” is real & can result in riskier behavior. But we can’t allow it to overcome us if we want to protect our economy, vulnerable Nevadans & our hospital capacity.

name: Governor Sisolak

tweet: Nevadans have made so much progress in the fight against COVID-19 and now is the time to double down to ensure that we can lift these restrictions while protecting ourselves and our economy.

tweet: We will continue to hold the course on other mitigation measures – including required face coverings in public spaces and strict 6-feet social distancing requirements. The COVID-19 Task Force – will continue to meet with counties that have an elevated risk of spreading COVID-19.

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: If somewhere else is pitching you on anything other than our standard, I want to remind you: you deserve better. You deserve a place with the strongest COVID worker protections in the nation, where industry, workers, & residents unite to be the gold standard. You deserve Nevada.

tweet: Protecting Nevadans is my top priority, and adopting this pre-emptive emergency regulation is a critical piece of our broader plan to anticipate and prepare for the potential impacts of COVID-19. 2/2

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Today, in coordination with @nevadadoi, I signed an emergency regulation to ensure that Nevadans covered by health insurance are able to obtain medical services & prescriptions related to COVID-19 at their normal costs, despite disruptions caused by the spread of the virus. 1/2  https://t.co/9K8180raIV

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: Earlier today, @SNHDinfo announced Nevada’s first presumptive positive case of COVID-19.   As stated by SNHD, test results are considered “presumptive positive” until confirmed by the federal @CDCgov. 1/3  https://t.co/S5Owc8EC3e

name: Governor Sisolak
tweet: TY to everyone who attended & watched our press conference briefing the public on recent efforts surrounding COVID-19.
